In *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*, the **spellbook of restore ability** allows you to learn the **spell of restore ability**. It is considered an [emergency spell](/wiki/Emergency_spell "Emergency spell"), and is the [special spell](/wiki/Special_spell "Special spell") for [Monks](/wiki/Monk "Monk").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)
- [2 Effect](#Effect)
- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)
- [4 History](#History)

## Generation

Monks receive this spellbook as their [crowning](/wiki/Crowning "Crowning") gift in lieu of an artifact.

## Effect

Casting this spell has the same effect as a [potion of restore ability](/wiki/Potion_of_restore_ability "Potion of restore ability"), except that it does not restore lost levels. At less than skilled in healing spells, it restores one random lost attribute of [strength](/wiki/Strength "Strength"), [dexterity](/wiki/Dexterity "Dexterity"), [constitution](/wiki/Constitution "Constitution"), [intelligence](/wiki/Intelligence "Intelligence"), [wisdom](/wiki/Wisdom "Wisdom"), or [charisma](/wiki/Charisma "Charisma") to its previous maximum amount, like an uncursed potion. At skilled or expert, it restores all six attributes like a blessed potion.

## Strategy

Valuable as the spell's effects are, by the time the vast majority of characters even discover the spellbook - let alone become capable of casting it - they are likely to have ready access to [unicorn horns](/wiki/Unicorn_horn "Unicorn horn"), which do a number of useful things in addition to restoring diminished ability scores. Monks receive the special spell bonus when casting this spell, and *might* just be in a position to require it before the first unicorn appears and is dispatched.

In [SporkHack](/wiki/SporkHack "SporkHack"), [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack") and [xNetHack](/wiki/XNetHack "XNetHack") this spell is considerably more valuable since the unicorn horn no longer restores lost attributes. Once this spell is learned, you are safe to abuse your stats (e.g. by remaining satiated, consorting with foocubi), since any attributes lost can be easily restored. You will also accumulate potions of restore ability, which can now be used for dilution. Similarly, in [Fourk](/wiki/Fourk "Fourk"), unicorn horns lose one point of [enchantment](/wiki/Enchantment "Enchantment"), making horns a somewhat limited resource.

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Unicorn horns can no longer restore reduced attributes in vanilla NetHack, so the value of this spell has increased as described above.

## History

The spellbook was called the **spellbook of restore strength** at its introduction, along with spells themselves, in [NetHack 1.3d](/wiki/NetHack_1.3d "NetHack 1.3d"). It was renamed to **spellbook of restore ability** in [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0"), which also introduced the modern six-attribute system.

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.4. Click here for more information.](/images/3/37/Nh364-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.4. Click here for more information.")

**This page may need to be updated for the [current version](/wiki/Current_version "Current version") of *NetHack*.**

It may contain text specific to [NetHack 3.6.4](/wiki/NetHack_3.6.4 "NetHack 3.6.4"). Information on this page may be out of date.

**Editors:** After reviewing this page and making necessary edits, please change the {{nethack-364}} tag to the current version's tag or {{noversion}} as appropriate.
